title: Domain 5.7: Given a scenario, troubleshoot problems with wired and wireless networks.
content:
📶 5.7 – Common Network Symptoms & What They Mean

📡 Intermittent Wireless Connectivity

Often due to weak signal, interference, or poorly configured access points.

🐢 Slow Network Speeds

Caused by bandwidth congestion, long distance from router, or outdated firmware.

⚠️ Limited Connectivity

"Connected, no Internet" message — often a DHCP or default gateway issue.

🔁 Jitter

Variation in packet arrival times. Disrupts real-time services like VoIP and video calls.

🎤📞 Poor VoIP Quality

Caused by jitter, latency, and packet loss — usually from network congestion.

🔌🔄 Port Flapping

Port constantly goes up/down — likely a bad cable, port, or NIC.

🕒 High Latency

Delay between sending and receiving data — problematic for gaming and streaming.

📻🚫 External Interference

Devices like microwaves or cordless phones can interfere, especially on 2.4GHz Wi-Fi bands.
